screen_desc: The screenshot shows the home screen of the Google Play Store on a smartphone. A pop-up is displayed introducing Google Play Pass, offering hundreds of games and apps for $4.99/month without ads or in-app purchases. There are three tabs at the bottom for Games, Apps, and Books.
action_think: The user wants to install the Spotify app. To achieve this, I need to guide the user to the 'Apps' tab, find the Spotify app, and then install it. The user can scroll through the list of apps to find Spotify.
action_plan: Scroll through the list of apps to find Spotify
action_result: The user has clicked on the grey spaces located out of the pop-up window. This action has removed the pop-up window from the screen, allowing the user to access the app store and search for the Spotify app. This is necessary because the user needs to find and install the Spotify app from the app store.
prev_action_result: The Play Store icon has been clicked, which will take you to the Play Store application. This action will help in finding the Spotify app and proceeding with the installation.
